Marketing Officer Job at Transnational Zamiva Services




        
    

        
        Zamiva Transnational Services is a full-fledged human capital development and management consultancy servicing company incorporated in August, 2021 with its corporate Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to ensuring quality value addition to our clients’ businesses spanning all sectors of the economy in the areas of HR consulting, outsourcing, talent acquisition, executive search, employee/reference background verification, payroll management, learning & development, renting, catering and janitorial services, etc., leveraging research, technology, a highly skilled and passionate human capital base, and our core values of Collaboration, Leadership, Integrity, Continuous Improvement, High Performance and Expertise.
     

            
    



We are seasoned human resources professionals and management strategists with enviable corporate exposure and experience spanning various sectors of the economy, including banking, logistics & courier, engineering, manufacturing, pharmaceuticals, food & beverages, oil & gas, telecommunication, private security services, hospitality.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Officer

Job Location: Egbeda, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	All candidates should possess a minimum of HND / BSc Degree in any discipline
	Minimum of 1-2 years of experience as a Marketing / Sales Officer in a structured hospital environment is an advantage
	Applicants living around Egbeda, Ikotun, Egbeda, Iyana-Ipaja, Oshodi, Idimu and environs will have an advantage


Salary
N100,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their detailed CV to: transnationalzamiva21@yahoo.com and metusmetus73@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more enquiries, contact: 09060194404.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Production Accountant",
  "description": "Straight-Gate Publishers Limited is one of Nigeria&#39;s leading educational publisher. It was incorporated as a private liability company in 1997. Straight-Gate Publishers Limited has since been concerned with building a reputation for sound intellectual contents of all its titles. Straight-Gate Publishers Limitedis also engaged in the business of printing and publishing of religious and general titles. We serve as educational representative to foreign publishers located in different parts of the world. We have an effective coverage of all parts of the country through our dynamic representatives in cities and towns nationwide.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Production Accountant

Job Location:&nbsp;Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Production Accountant will be responsible for overseeing the financial and operational aspects of book production in our publishing company.
	This role combines accounting expertise with hands-on production management to ensure cost efficiency, quality control, and timely delivery of printed materials.


Duties and Responsibilities


	Prepare and monitor production budgets, ensuring alignment with company financial goals.
	Maintain accurate cost estimates and prepare final cost reports for all book projects.
	Track, analyze, and report on production expenses, identifying cost-saving opportunities.
	Prepare annual production financial reports, including profit and loss analysis per title.
	Reconcile production-related accounts with the finance department.
	Provide cost breakdowns for each stage of printing (pre-press, press, and post-press).
	Supervise and coordinate with printing press operators, designers, bindery staff, and vendors.
	Monitor production schedules and ensure timely completion of all titles.
	Ensure optimal use and maintenance of printing equipment and machines
	Ensure quality control at every stage of production to maintain publishing standards.
	Plan production workflow and allocate resources efficiently to avoid downtime.
	Support external and internal audits with accurate production-related financial records.
	Utilize accounting software for expense tracking, invoicing, and reporting.
	Oversee day-to-day operations of the printing process from manuscript handover to final product delivery.
	Ensure compliance with industry safety standards and company policies.


Job Specialization


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related discipline (professional qualifications such as ICAN, ACCA, or CIPFA are an added advantage).
	Minimum of 5 years of cognate experience in publishing and printing production.
	Strong knowledge of production processes, printing machinery, and book publishing standards.

Production Accountant Job at Straight-Gate Publishers Limited




        
    

        
        Straight-Gate Publishers Limited is one of Nigeria's leading educational publisher. It was incorporated as a private liability company in 1997. Straight-Gate Publishers Limited has since been concerned with building a reputation for sound intellectual contents of all its titles. Straight-Gate Publishers Limitedis also engaged in the business of printing and publishing of religious and general titles. We serve as educational representative to foreign publishers located in different parts of the world. We have an effective coverage of all parts of the country through our dynamic representatives in cities and towns nationwide.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Production Accountant
     

            
    



Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Production Accountant will be responsible for overseeing the financial and operational aspects of book production in our publishing company.
	This role combines accounting expertise with hands-on production management to ensure cost efficiency, quality control, and timely delivery of printed materials.


Duties and Responsibilities


	Prepare and monitor production budgets, ensuring alignment with company financial goals.
	Maintain accurate cost estimates and prepare final cost reports for all book projects.
	Track, analyze, and report on production expenses, identifying cost-saving opportunities.
	Prepare annual production financial reports, including profit and loss analysis per title.
	Reconcile production-related accounts with the finance department.
	Provide cost breakdowns for each stage of printing (pre-press, press, and post-press).
	Supervise and coordinate with printing press operators, designers, bindery staff, and vendors.
	Monitor production schedules and ensure timely completion of all titles.
	Ensure optimal use and maintenance of printing equipment and machines
	Ensure quality control at every stage of production to maintain publishing standards.
	Plan production workflow and allocate resources efficiently to avoid downtime.
	Support external and internal audits with accurate production-related financial records.
	Utilize accounting software for expense tracking, invoicing, and reporting.
	Oversee day-to-day operations of the printing process from manuscript handover to final product delivery.
	Ensure compliance with industry safety standards and company policies.


Job Specialization


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related discipline (professional qualifications such as ICAN, ACCA, or CIPFA are an added advantage).
	Minimum of 5 years of cognate experience in publishing and printing production.
	Strong knowledge of production processes, printing machinery, and book publishing standards.
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g. SAGE)
	Strong budgeting, cost-control, and financial analysis skills.
	Excellent leadership, negotiation, and communication skills
	Strong organisational and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
	Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple production projects simultaneously.


Salary
N150,000 - 200,000 monthly (Depending on Experience and Qualification).
